intro: Convallaria linnaei, commonly known as the Linnæus' Lily of the Valley, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Convallariaceae. It is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically evergreen, and it produces red berries that contain seeds. Native to the forests of northern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and toxic properties, it is often cultivated in gardens but requires careful handling.
